abstract: The deal, which could be worth up to $20 billion, would rejoin Visa, the world’s biggest payment network, with a subsidiary it spun off in 2007.
snippet: The deal, which could be worth up to $20 billion, would rejoin Visa, the world’s biggest payment network, with a subsidiary it spun off in 2007.
lead_paragraph: Visa is in early discussions to reunite with its former European unit, bringing together two businesses that have operated separately for eight years, a person briefed on the matter said on Friday.

headline.main: Visa and Visa Europe Are Said to Consider Reunification

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
